resources.string: Thank you for downloading Money Manager. The purpose of this application is to help you keep track of who you\'ve lent or borrowed money from.\n

• The first step in using Money Manager is to add people for which you can create entries. This can be done through the \'Add New Person\' option on the main screen or when creating the actual entry itself. When creating a new person, you can also add a prexisting balance if one exists.\n

• Next, it\'s time to add an entry. The add entry screen can be displayed via the \'Add New Entry\' button on the main screen. Here there are form fields pertaining to the entry itself. These fields include:\n
• Who - Tapping this field will display a screen where you can select people you\'ve created. You can select more than one person for an entry. Also, you can add new people here too.\n
• Where - A text box pertaining to where the entry occurred or what the entry was.\n
• Amount - Tapping this field displays a pop-up where you can supply an amount for the entry as well check-off whether you lent or borrowed money.\n
• Notes - A text box where you can enter any other notes you\'d like to keep track of.\n
• All fields are mandatory except the Notes field. When all the fields have been filled, select the \'Submit\' button on the bottom of the screen and the entry will be complete.\n

• When an entry pertains to multiple people, checking the \'Divide Total Balance\' option will change the amount entered for each person in the entry to be the total amount entered divided by the number of people. Otherwise, the total amount entered will be attributed to each user. Checking off the \'Include Self\' option will deduct an amount pertaining to you before dividing the balance among others.\n
• To view balances, tap the \'View Balances\' button on the main screen. This will display the balance screen where you can see an overview of all the balances you hold with people.\n\n
Balances indicate that you are currently in debt with that person.\n
Balances indicate that you currently hold a credit that person.\n\n

• Clicking on any of the rows in the list will bring you to the Balance screen for that person. Here you can see a summary of the entries you have with that person. Also, this screen offers the ability to edit the balance you have with that person and also to delete that person.\n
